solution_line_template: First figure out how much Nancy has to pay after her parents pay their half by dividing the tuition by {parents_share_divisor}: ${total_tuition} / {parents_share_divisor} = $<<{total_tuition}/{parents_share_divisor}={remaining_tuition_after_parents}>>{remaining_tuition_after_parents}.

Then figure out how much Nancy's student loan is by multiplying her scholarship amount by {loan_multiplier}: ${scholarship_amount} * {loan_multiplier} = $<<{scholarship_amount}*{loan_multiplier}={student_loan_amount}>>{student_loan_amount}.

Now subtract the amounts of Nancy's scholarship and loan to find out how much tuition she has to pay by working: ${remaining_tuition_after_parents} - ${scholarship_amount} - ${student_loan_amount} = $<<{remaining_tuition_after_parents}-{scholarship_amount}-{student_loan_amount}={tuition_to_pay_by_working}>>{tuition_to_pay_by_working}.

Now divide the remaining unpaid tuition by the number of hours Nancy works to find out how much she needs to make per hour: ${tuition_to_pay_by_working} / {total_work_hours} hours = $<<{tuition_to_pay_by_working}/{total_work_hours}={hourly_wage_needed}>>{hourly_wage_needed}/hour.
